but really what needs to
change about this panel itself,

4188.59.text:
and how does it feel
sitting there in this space?

4201.16.text:
>> I was actually
going to touch on that.

4204.05.text:
So, change starts with
us as individuals.

4209.03.text:
So it's funny because I actually
reached over to you and said,

4214.46.text:
there's some aboriginal
women up there

4216.41.text: that want to ask a question.

4217.91.text:
So let's never mind
that this timer stopped,

4221.43.text:
As the original people
of this territory.

4225.08.text:
And so, further to that, I have
to own my own privilege too.

4231.85.text:
In that, I have an
opportunity to sit here.

4234.40.text:
I have an opportunity
to speak in this space,

4236.28.text: but I have that same question.

4237.94.text:
That same question has been
lingering in the back of my mind

4241.35.text:
since I walked in
here last night.

4243.83.text:
Where are the original
people of this territory?

4251.98.text:
I have privilege in that I'm
given that responsibility

4255.66.text: to do this work for our Mother.

4257.26.text:
It doesn't matter where
I am on this Earth.

4260.48.text:
So just like you,
Marawa when you came

4262.63.text:
to my community a year ago, you
came there and you spoke there

4269.43.text:
as responsibility
to your people here.

4277.41.text:
And so, all I can do is
do my very best to speak

4282.22.text: for each and every one of us.

4284.25.text:
To speak for those next seven
generations coming ahead,

4287.70.text:
and those future generations
and those ones back there

4290.86.text: that fought and died for us.

4293.38.text:
Doesn't matter where I
am in this Mother Earth.

4297.88.text:
>> Thank you very much
for your question.

4311.12.text:
And unfortunately that is
the all we have time for.

4317.54.text:
Anne and Marsha thank you very
much for joining us today.
